result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy R Manka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  If the defendant is placed on probation or released to extended supervision, IT IS ORDERED that the defendant pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
No loud, profane, violent, abusive, threatening or disorderly contact with: the victims.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Payment Plan Request.  Not granted as case is DOC collect.  Wrote letter letting him know to pay his probation office directly and contact them regarding payment plan.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Terrien.  Defendant plead guilty to count 1.  Defendant plead no contest to count 2.    Court recited the charges and possible penalties on the counts he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Repeater allegation confirmed.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of disorderly conduct contrary to 947.01(1) and misdemeanor bail jumping, contrary to 946.49(1)(a), both as a repeater.  State recommended:  Probation for 2 years.  Concurrent with Wood County case number 16CM289.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.    No violent, abusive, threatening or disorderly contact with the victims.   Defense requesting 1 year probation.  

Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 18 months probation.  Concurrent with Wood County case number 16CM289.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.    No loud, profane, violent, threatening or disorderly contact with the victims.  CC    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
PLEAS rescheduled at request of Atty Terrien.
PLEAS rescheduled due to court scheduling needs.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 7, 2016 at 10:00 am.
STC canceled & set for PLEAS per atty.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Terrien.    Waive reading of the complaint.  Defendant stood mute.   NGP entered by the court.  PTC 9/21 and STC 10/10.  Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant changed his mind.  Defendant will contact SPD.  If defendant proceeds without an attorney, the court will need to review this form with the defendant.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties contained in the complaint.  He understood.  Court advised the defendant of his attorney options.  Defendant wants to waive his right to counsel.  Defendant filled out the form.  Defendant will contact SPD.  AIA set for 8/29 at 9 am.  Bond continued.
